required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: DAILIES TOTAL1® - Comparative Assessment of Tear Film Evaporation
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study on the Effect of Daily Disposable Silicone Hydrogel Contact Lenses on Tear Film Lipids

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the tear film evaporation of symptomatic soft contact lens wearers in the absence of contact lens wear and after at least 8 hours of contact lens wear.

detailed_description.textblock: This study consists of 5 visits (1 screening, 4 assessment) with a maximum of 6 days between assessment visits and at least 24 hours of no lens wear the day prior to the visit. Each subject will be randomized to a crossover sequence of 4 periods. Different study lenses will be worn during 3 of the periods, for at least 8 hours each, and the remaining period will have no lens wear.

primary_outcome.description: Tear film evaporation rate (amount of tears (grams or g) that evaporates over a surface area (m2) per hour (h)) assessment was performed using the VapoMeter as a non-invasive measurement of tear film evaporation over 10 seconds. Measurements were taken on both the right and left eyes after 8 hours of lens wear or no lens wear, as applicable. A higher evaporation rate can be a contributing factor to eye irritation and lens intolerance.

arm_group.description: Delefilcon A, then narafilcon A, then somofilcon A, then no lens wear. Each contact lens product was worn for 8 hours. The 'No Lens wear' treatment was evaluated over an 8 hour period.
Narafilcon A, then no lens wear, then delefilcon A, then somofilcon A. Each contact lens product was worn for 8 hours. The 'No Lens wear' treatment was evaluated over an 8 hour period.
Somofilcon A, then delefilcon A, then no lens wear, then narafilcon A. Each contact lens product was worn for 8 hours. The 'No Lens wear' treatment was evaluated over an 8 hour period.
No lens wear, then somofilcon A, then narafilcon A, then delefilcon A. Each contact lens product was worn for 8 hours. The 'No Lens wear' treatment was evaluated over an 8 hour period.

intervention.description: Daily disposable, silicone hydrogel contact lenses used according to manufacturer's instructions
Daily disposable, silicone hydrogel contact lenses used according to manufacturer's instructions
Daily disposable, silicone hydrogel contact lenses used according to manufacturer's instructions

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from 1 study center located in Australia.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 37 enrolled, 7 subjects were exited as screen failures prior to randomization and 1 subject discontinued after randomization prior to exposure to the investigational product. This reporting group includes all randomized and exposed subjects (29).

participants_list.participants: One subject discontinued between Period 3 and Period 4 (withdrawal by subject)

baseline.population: This analysis population includes all subjects/eyes exposed to any investigational product (including the ‘No Lens wear’ treatment) evaluated in this study, except for lenses used at Visit 1 for the purpose of parameter optimization and fitting, as they were not intended for the assessment of safety and effectiveness (Safety Analysis Set).

group.title: Overall
group.description: Delefilcon A, narafilcon A, and somofilcon A contact lenses worn bilaterally (in both eyes) and a period of no lens wear in a randomized crossover fashion

outcome.title: Tear Film Evaporation Rate
outcome.description: Tear film evaporation rate (amount of tears (grams or g) that evaporates over a surface area (m2) per hour (h)) assessment was performed using the VapoMeter as a non-invasive measurement of tear film evaporation over 10 seconds. Measurements were taken on both the right and left eyes after 8 hours of lens wear or no lens wear, as applicable. A higher evaporation rate can be a contributing factor to eye irritation and lens intolerance.
outcome.population: This analysis population includes all randomized subjects (Intent-to-Treat). To address the primary objective of comparing Lens vs. No Lens, results from all 3 study lenses are combined. Therefore, subjects (eyes) are counted multiple times in Lens group due to crossover design and number of eyes with non-missing response is reported.

group.title: Lens
group.description: Delefilcon A contact lenses, narafilcon A contact lenses, and somofilcon A contact lenses worn bilaterally in cross-over fashion as randomized. Each product worn for one day, 8 hours minimum.

group.title: No Lens
group.description: One 8-hour day of no lens wear as part of the crossover sequence

measure.title: Tear Film Evaporation Rate
measure.description: Tear film evaporation rate (amount of tears (grams or g) that evaporates over a surface area (m2) per hour (h)) assessment was performed using the VapoMeter as a non-invasive measurement of tear film evaporation over 10 seconds. Measurements were taken on both the right and left eyes after 8 hours of lens wear or no lens wear, as applicable. A higher evaporation rate can be a contributing factor to eye irritation and lens intolerance.
measure.population: This analysis population includes all randomized subjects (Intent-to-Treat). To address the primary objective of comparing Lens vs. No Lens, results from all 3 study lenses are combined. Therefore, subjects (eyes) are counted multiple times in Lens group due to crossover design and number of eyes with non-missing response is reported.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were collected from time of consent for the duration of a subject’s participation in the study (up to 5 weeks). AEs are reported as pretreatment and treatment-emergent.
reported_events.desc: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence, unintended disease or injury, or untoward clinical signs (including abnormal laboratory findings) in subjects, users or other persons, whether or not related to the medical device.

group.title: Pretreatment
group.description: All subjects who consented to participate in the study prior to exposure to the investigational product (including the ‘No Lens wear’ treatment)

group.title: DAILIES TOTAL1
group.description: All subjects exposed to DT1 contact lenses worn for 8 hours during Period 1, 2, 3, or 4 as randomized

group.title: TruEye
group.description: All subjects exposed to TruEye contact lenses worn for 8 hours during Period 1, 2, 3, or 4 as randomized

group.title: Clariti
group.description: All subjects exposed to clariti contact lenses worn for 8 hours during Period 1, 2, 3, or 4 as randomized

group.title: No Lens
group.description: All subjects exposed to "No lens wear" for 8 hours during Period 1, 2, 3, or 4 as randomized

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor reserves the right of prior review of any publication or presentation of information related to the study.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Sr Global Brand Medical Affairs Lead, GCRA
